alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 11:13PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Arizona and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Minor street flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1112 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Jacks Canyon, Oak Creek, Turkey Creek, Dry Beaver Creek and Dry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sedona, Village At Oak Creek, Red Rock State Park and Manzanita Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
